mods.abstract: NOTICE. THE following named negroes have been turned over to me by the Agents and Officers of his Excellency Henry W. Allen Gov. of La. Negro woman, Emma, dark complexion aged about twenty-five years, said to belong to Jacob Newcomer, Jefferson County Arkansas. Hannah, a negro woman and infant, black color, aged about twenty-five ears, said to belong to Joseph Andrews, Madison Parish La. Diannah, a negro woman of griffe color, aged about twenty years, said to belong to Mr. Stephens, east of the Mississippi river. Mary Ann, girl of yellow color, aged about ten years, said to belong to Dr. Page. Shack, a negro man of black color, aged about twenty two years, said to belong to ------ The owner or owners of said negroes are hereby notified to come forward, prove property, pay charges, and take them away. J.W. Mahle, Jailor, Caddo Parish, June 19 -- tf
mods.note: Jacob Newcomer; Joseph Andrews; Mr. Stephens; Dr. Page
Emma (20); Hannah (25) and infant; Diannah (20); Mary Ann (10); Shack (22)
Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
